content.rendered:
Photo via Unsplash

This Week in Genesis, a fresh mix of the latest and greatest happenings in the Genesis community including the launch of Jesse Petersen’s GenesisThe.me, a new Genesis slider plugin, and a fresh project from Tonya Mork.

Plus the usual round-up of the finest themes, tutorials, and your showcase sites.

Let’s get to it.

Themes

Jesse Petersen goes live with his new GenesisThe.me project…

Didn’t wait for the site/EDD to be perfect, per the wise @syedbalkhi. @_GenesisTheme is open! https://t.co/e0vfGLoBZf #genesiswp

— Jesse Ⓦ Petersen (@jpetersen) September 12, 2016

…starting out with a mobile first Sass starter theme.

Ready to start your next #genesiswp project? Start mobile-first with a Sass starter theme: https://t.co/iYOTLQRl8Z pic.twitter.com/ywu18UTqCE

— Jesse Ⓦ Petersen (@jpetersen) September 14, 2016

And ZigZigPress released their 32nd (yes thirty second) Genesis theme, Plugged.

Announcing our 32nd #genesiswp child theme: Plugged https://t.co/x61yqZKvLt

— zigzagpress.com (@zigzagpress) September 16, 2016

Ryan Townley’s Minimal Genesis has an update on their previous theme tease for the next Minimal Genesis theme.

Our next #genesiswp theme is looking quite a bit different than the sneak peek we tweeted a bit ago, but for good reason.

— Minimal Genesis (@minimalgenesis) September 14, 2016

Showcase

New site, thegirlnextdoorgrowsup.com, from Erika Quagliano and she wants your feedback!

Site re-design for The Girl Next Door Grows Up

Nice site by Anothony Russo for thecultureist.com

Really happy w/the redesign of @TheCultureist I'm adding new enhancements soon #genesiswp https://t.co/ojeaoGfrlv pic.twitter.com/6yILU3w2RE

— Anthony Russo (@LifeDezigned) September 15, 2016

He didn’t announce it 😉 but Quincy Zikmund updated his personal site, quincyzikmund.com, with a minimal vibe.

@CalliaWeb I took this approach in launching my site over the weekend.

— Quincy Zikmund (@quincyzikmund) September 14, 2016

Susan Ramsey launches a new travel blog (using the Isabelle theme), journeywithsusan.com

Just launched! https://t.co/5mxvSkfikw – using the #GenesisWP Isabelle theme by @TheCre8tiveDiva pic.twitter.com/n0vRtfqI6t

— Susan Ramsey (@onehappystudio) September 12, 2016

Nicola Tweed for caitlyndebeer.com

One of my 1st ever clients recently got a pretty little revamp https://t.co/H6MlXIkY8y #genesiswp #WordPress pic.twitter.com/FnGIyqs84c

— Nicola Tweed (@nicolatweed) September 14, 2016

PIXL Designs with two new sites, vidaen6palabras.org and habladecristo.org

1 of 2 Spanish-speaking sites designed on #genesiswp to help seekers find truth https://t.co/UrhFyfEbK3 pic.twitter.com/uqn8ZZZvtT

— PIXL Designs (@pixldesigns) September 12, 2016

2 of 2 Spanish-speaking sites built on #genesiswp to connect teens with faith questions. https://t.co/APLq47Mo4Z pic.twitter.com/af2AtAiPCC

— PIXL Designs (@pixldesigns) September 12, 2016

Best of the rest

ZigZagPress launch a new Genesis slider plugin, ZP Post Slider.

Looking for a great #genesiswp slider plugin? Give this one a try: https://t.co/N7O742mafo

— zigzagpress.com (@zigzagpress) September 17, 2016

In the wake of some news about Headway Themes, Cobalt Apps – maker of two Genesis related products, Dynamik and Extender – puts out a statement reassuring customers that they’ll ‘receive support and attention for years to come’.

Some clarity: https://t.co/skydSaajiV #wordpress #genesiswp

— Cobalt Apps (@cobaltapps) September 13, 2016

Chris McIntosh with an update on his Bolt Pro starter theme.

Wait no longer! Here is a poorly narrated tutorial on how to get started with Bolt Pro. More to come. #genesiswphttps://t.co/wdX0afxn9K

— Chris Mcintosh (@akamac) September 16, 2016

Sridhar Katakam with a few tutorials as ever this week, including how to set a custom Primary Sidebar for all Pages using a Page Template

How to set a custom Primary Sidebar for all Pages using a Page Template:https://t.co/6Iz6MMM49S#GenesisWP pic.twitter.com/SDPQCNFvFn

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) September 13, 2016

…how to make a specific section in Genesis editable via Beaver Builder.

How to make a specific section in #GenesisWP editable via @BeaverBuilder:https://t.co/CHAWdhKTxz pic.twitter.com/OrHFnDUOPS

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) September 14, 2016

…and how to set up different sideabars for archives and pages in Genesis.

How to set up different sidebars for archives and Pages in Genesis:https://t.co/T80lSaNMYD#GenesisWP

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) September 12, 2016

League WP with a tutorial on adding a logo before a site title in Genesis.

How to Show a Logo Before Site Title (#GenesisWP) – League WP https://t.co/VrawtHdjog

— League WP (@league_wp) September 15, 2016

Calvin Koepke with a small (but beautiful) Genesis development tip.

Pro tip: if you ever need to make the entry title a non-link:

add_filter( ‘genesis_link_post_title’, false );#genesiswp

— Calvin Koepke (@cjkoepke) September 13, 2016

Not directly Genesis related, but definitely interesting, another new project from Tonya Mork (of Know The Code fame), called Know the Business.

Do you want to learn more about the business side of #WordPress? Then follow @KnowTheBusiness & sign up at https://t.co/uL8ceVkYWY.

— Tonya Mork (@hellofromTonya) September 15, 2016

Offering business advice for WordPress developers, if you’re interested you can go sign up now at knowthebusiness.io

And finally…

Don’t worry Andrea, we’ve all been there!

Every time @GaryJ helps me with something: https://t.co/TMruGDdaZd #genesiswp

— Andrea Whitmer (@nutsandbolts) September 12, 2016

excerpt.rendered: Jesse Petersen’s GenesisThe.me goes live, a new Genesis slider plugin, and a fresh project from Tonya Mork.
